tasks.task: Provide educational materials for farm equipment dealers and customers regarding EGR and SCR technologies.
subtasks: Conduct surveys of dealers to assess concerns about new engine technologies.
Analyze dealer feedback and identify common frustrations related to conflicting manufacturer claims.
Compile real-world data comparing performance (maintenance, fuel efficiency, repairs) of tractors using different technologies.
Develop objective marketing pieces and side-by-side tests to address customer confusion.

tasks.task: Educate customers through advertising and promoting the benefits of new engine technologies.
subtasks: Create awareness campaigns to inform customers about exhaust gas recirculation and selective catalytic reduction.
Provide educational resources for customers to understand the different methods and technologies.

tasks.task: Extend warranties on new equipment as a confidence measure.
subtasks: Offer longer warranties to demonstrate manufacturers' trust in their products.
Communicate warranty extensions as a value proposition to customers.

tasks.task: Enhance dealer knowledge to alleviate customer concerns.
subtasks: Train dealers on competing products to provide balanced information.
Encourage dealers to fact-check manufacturer claims and present unbiased advice to customers.

tasks.task: The video transcript details the EGR versus SCR debate in the farm equipment industry. The main tasks include providing educational materials (MAINTASK), such as conducting surveys (subtask), analyzing dealer feedback (subtask), compiling real-world data (subtask), and developing objective marketing pieces (subtask). Educating customers through advertising (MAINTASK) and promoting the benefits of the new technologies is another key aspect (subtask). Additionally, extending warranties (MAINTASK) on new equipment can help ease customer concerns, though this may not be feasible without market pressure. Finally, enhancing dealer knowledge (MAINTASK) is crucial; they must be trained to understand competing products and present unbiased information (subtasks).
Provide educational materials for farm equipment dealers and customers regarding EGR and SCR technologies.

Compile real-world data comparing performance (maintenance, fuel efficiency, repairs) of tractors using different technologies.
Develop objective marketing pieces and side-by-side tests to address customer confusion.
